name: jekyll-starter-tailwind
description: A starter kit for using Tailwind with Jekyll

scripts.build-prod: NODE_ENV=production npm run build-gulp && npm run build
scripts.watch: npm run build-gulp && npm run build && run-p browsersync watch:**
scripts.watch:colour-overrides: onchange -k './assets/styles/overrides/_03-colour-overrides.scss' -- onerror "npm run-s tailwind:config-export build:css browsersync:reload" --title "There was a SCSS compilation error"
scripts.watch:js: onchange -k './assets/js/**/*.js' -- onerror "run-s build:js browsersync:reload-js" --title "There was a JS formatting or syntax error"
scripts.watch:scss: onchange -k './assets/styles/**/*.scss' -- onerror "run-s build:css browsersync:reload-css" --title "There was a SCSS compilation error"
scripts.watch:tailwind: onchange -k './tailwind.js' -- onerror "npm run-s tailwind:config-export build:css browsersync:reload" --title "There was a SCSS compilation error"
scripts.lodash:
npx lodash-cli strict -o ./dist/lodash.js include=$( grep -roh "_\.[[:alpha:]]*" /assets/js/ --include=*.js | sort | uniq | cut -b 3- | tr "
" "," )
scripts.postinstall:build: if [ "$NODE_ENV" != "production" ]; then npm run build; fi

author: Lincoln Chawora
